intro: Pedicularis aequibarbis, commonly known as the bearded lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture. Pedicularis aequibarbis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found growing in mountainous or subalpine habitats.
